scenarioDescription:
The HD 206255 Exoplanetary System


Overview

HD 206255 is a star with 1.42 times the mass of the Sun, and NaN times its radius. It is located 245.39 light years away from the solar system.

HD 206255 is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the HD 206255 system


HD 206255 b

HD 206255 b was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory observatory, in 2019-06, using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 0.46 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of HD 206255 b is 34.217 times the mass of Earth. The radius of HD 206255 b is 6.470 that of Earth. At more than 10 Earth masses, HD 206255 b is an ice giant, a planet that is made up mostly of volatiles like water, amonia and methane, and enveloped by a dense hydrogen and helium atmosphere, much like Uranus and Neptune in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanetary system HD 206255, which contains 1 exoplanets and was discovered by the Las Campanas Observatory.
name: HD 206255 - System With 1 Exoplanet
